author: Novelty
title: Hubble Bubble
review:
This is a rather difficult to find set outside of the US.  Let's start with the chariot.  It's weird.  Why are there wings at the rear of the chariot?  It looks weird and out of place.  The chariot is also rather unbalanced, not as a result of the wings.  The two nice things about the chariot though is the brown horse and the design just in front of the wizard.

The tower is really just a combination of big parts, but that's not visible at the end of the design.  It looks rather well designed and well built with two towers and the flaming pots.  There is a stairway up to what must be majisto's tower and from there it's a hop, skip and jump (literally) to the other tower.  The design also incorporates the painted bricks rather nicely.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Some very useful castle pieces here
review: I remember seeing this set on sale when I was a kid and recently obtained one off eBay.  Yes, the chariot is kind of weird, but you get three figures and a horse.  Most importantly you get several great castle pieces.  There's a curved staircase, some turret walls, doors, a green baseplate, a unique dragon-printed wall, arches, ramparts and a red tower roof!  To top things off you can use the box as an addition to your mini castle.  This set is definitely worth getting if you're looking to add to your castle parts bin or if you just want something to play with on its own.

author: Legowarroir
title: Awsome set!
review:
I just got this off bricklink and it is a very cool set. another thing that is cool is the cut out box. we can connect it to the castle. This is probably the second biggest dragon knights set (dragon knights only have two big sets).


                   Pros.

                   The tower
                   the knights
                   wizard and the carrier thing with the horse.

                   Bad.

                   none

author: samuraiturtle
title: The Wizards Work Shop
review: A good set for $20 (at the time it first came out).  This does have lot of rare parts like the staircase, red roof, plus some printed peices (a magic scroll, the dragons on the arch, and the dragons on the wall peice), and a cloth flag that goes at the top of the tower.  This set also come with a wizard with his wand, two sholders one with a rare helmet, and a brown horse with a "horse helmet".  Like some of the others have said I do not know why their are wings on the chariot, but I like to think it is for emergency stoping.  Over all a good medium set if you need a bulding for your town/city.  But, like most sets their is not a back wall so do not thing the thing is a inclosed bulding.

author: NickBrick
title: Huge!
review:
I recently found my brothers old Legos in my dads garage and he had a ton!so far this is my favorite set...with the exeption of the chrome crusher from Rock raiders.this set is big and looks even bigger when you build the charriot.time for some pros and cons.

                                               Pros.

                                            lots of great castle pieces
                                            very tall
                                            sweet charriot
                                            horse
                                            cool flag

                                               Cons.
                                           know bad guys for them to fight.
 
                                overall pretty good set from the figs to the size.

author: SirSven7
title: Lego Steve's Review
review:
This set is very difficult to find outside of the US and that is a terrible shame. The set has some flaws (the chariot looks terrible) but the structure itself is so nice and you receive so many good building parts (staircase, printed archway, red roof, ect...) that it is hard to be negative. LEGO is the type of product that, as long as you have a visually pleasing set you will always get a good result, this set is one example of that, the build is a little blocky (a couple of BURPS and wall/corner panels, ect..) but you can forgive that once you see the finished product,

I would advise anyone with a decent LEGO collection to have a go at building this one, it’s well worth it. It should also be noted that the set came with a cardboard castle to put alongside it sadly I don’t have that so I can’t really comment.

If you like this review click on the link to find it and all reviews of the Castle sets

http://legosteveblog.blogspot.com/2012/01/lego-dragon-knights-sets-1993-1995.html
